msContents.summary: Valerius Longus acknowledges to Diodoros that he has from him a receipt for 3 artabas of wheat of Apion, son of Horion; therefore he frees Diodoros from liability

msItem.note: Written along the fibers; the back is blank; a space of 5 cm. is left blank at the bottom
13 lines of writing in large, clear letters
Text of difficult interpretation: there was some preexisting relationship between Longus and Diodoros

provenance.p: Purchased by Columbia University from Dr. Kondilios through H.I. Bell in July 1925; no. 160 in Bell's inventory

div.ab: Valerius Longus to Diodoros greetings. Since I have received from you a receipt of Apion son of Horion, for three artabas of wheat of the 6th year of Antoninus the lord, I will make you free of liability to him because of my possession of the writing of Apion. Year 7 of Antoninus Caesar the lord, Phamenoth 8.
